intro: Hieracium cebennense, commonly known as the Italian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium cebennense is known for its spreading growth habit and can form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
